result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Duane Zolicoffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: to any  other sentence.
First 2 months, Straight  Time, last 5 months with Huber for the Day Reporting Center if deemed appropriate by the department.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered the defendant to pay all Court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) and all applicable Supervision fees, by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Obtain/ maintain full-time employment/ education/ vocation, if doctor approved.
As a convicted felon, defendant may never possess a firearm and his voting rights are suspended until his civil rights are restored.

NO alcohol.    
NO drugs.    
NO possession/ consumption, selling/ distributing of illegal drugs or alcohol

Provide a DNA sample.   
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the department.  
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ random urine screens.

per order dated October 4, 2016, Appeal 2016XX54CR, the deadline for Court Reporter Laurie Burghardt to file transcripts in this matter is extended through November 29, 2016. Reporter Burghardt shall notify managing Court reporter Michelle Smith when the transcript in this matter is filed. If Reporter Burghardt has not notified managing Court Reporter Smith on or before November 29, 2016, that the outstanding transcript in this matter has been filed and served, then Reporter Smith shall file a report in this court no later than December 9, 2016, stating the arrangements she has made to facilitate the preparation of the transcript in this matter.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  First 2 months straight time, last 5 months with huber for the day reporting center if deemed appropriate by the department.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation if doctor approved.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Anthony Duane Zolicoffer in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 664
cf

Defendant Anthony Duane Zolicoffer in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.   Student Intern Larissa Dallman under the supervision of Attorney Jaspers.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties here on continuation of defense's motion to suppress hearing on 7/9/15.  Court finds the inevitable discovery applies and DENIES defense's motion to suppress.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 22.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's written argument in support of motion to suppress. Received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Duane Zolicoffer in court with Larissa Dallman under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB

Defendant Anthony Duane Zolicoffer in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Marissa Santiago for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signature bond that was previously signed to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances or without a valid prescription. No possession of any illegal drugs  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.
